keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject

lead_paragraph: Republicans say the administration is spending on health insurance subsidies without congressional authority, raising a question: Could future presidents shift funds as they like?

headline.print_headline: Arcane Fight May Tilt Power to the President
headline.main: How an Arcane Spending Fight Could Alter the Federal Balance of Power

snippet: Republicans say the administration is spending on health insurance subsidies without congressional authority, raising a question: Could future presidents shift funds as they like?...
abstract: Carl Hulse On Washington column argues seemingly esoteric quarrel between House Republicans and Pres Obama over healthcare spending could have broader implications for political system; asserts administration's bid to circumvent gridlocked Congress to obtain funding could set precedent of granting executive branch excess power.
